info.title: awork API
info.description: This is the API documentation for awork.

get.summary: Gets all the absence regions.
get.description:
Gets all the absence regions of the workspace.
            Depending on the user's permissions, the visibility of users assigned to the regions may vary.
            Admin will see all users assigned to all regions.
            Planner users with User Team Filter on (UserTeamsData) will only see same team users assigned to the regions.
            Any other user will only see themselves assigned to the regions.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

post.summary: Creates a new absence region.
post.description:
Creates a new absence region.
            An absence region is defined by an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code and a location code.
            There can be multiple absence regions for a country, but only one absence region for a country and location. (no duplicates)

<Info title="Subscription Level">This endpoint requires the Standard plan or higher.</Info>

<Check title="Required Permissions">The user must be an admin or have user-planning-data:write permissions.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model to create the absence region.

get.summary: List of supported countries for absence regions.
get.description:
Returns a list of supported countries for absence regions.
            A country is defined by an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

get.summary: List of locations for a country.
get.description:
Returns a list of all the locations of a country, expressed as ISO 3166-2 codes.
            It will include the regions and subregions (sublocations) of the country if available.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

put.summary: Assign/remove current user to/from an absence region.
put.description:
Assigns or removes the current user to/from an absence region.
            A user can be assigned to only one absence region.
            As such, if a user is already assigned to an absence region, he will be removed from the previous one and assigned to the new one.
            Providing a null region id will remove the user from any absence region.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model assign users to the region.

put.summary: Assign/remove users to an absence region.
put.description:
Only an admin or a user with UserPlanningData(write) permissions can assign/remove any user to an absence region.
            A user can be assigned to only one absence region.
            As such, if a user is already assigned to an absence region, he will be removed from the previous one and assigned to the new one.
            Providing an empty list of user ids will remove all users from the absence region.

<Check title="Required Permissions">The user must be an admin or have user-planning-data:write permissions.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model assign/remove users to/from the region.

delete.summary: Deletes an absence region.
delete.description:
Deletes an absence region by id, unassigning all users from the absence region.
            If there are workspace absences related to the region, they will be deleted as well.
            If the absence region is the default absence region, it will simply be deleted. (no default absence region).

<Check title="Required Permissions">The user must be an admin or have user-planning-data:write permissions.</Check>

parameters.name: absenceRegionId
parameters.description: The id of the absence region to delete.

get.summary: Get an absence region by id.
get.description:
Get an absence region by id.
            It will include the details of the public holidays for the country and location.
            Depending on the user's permissions, the visibility of users assigned to the regions may vary.
            Admin will see all users assigned to all regions.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: absenceRegionId
parameters.description: The id of the absence region to fetch.

put.summary: Updates an absence region.
put.description:
Updates an absence region.
            It is possible to update the name, country code, location code, and default status of an absence region.
            The name of the absence region must be unique.

<Check title="Required Permissions">The user must be an admin or have user-planning-data:write permissions.</Check>

parameters.name: absenceRegionId
parameters.description: The id of the absence region to delete.

requestBody.description: The model to update the absence region.

get.summary: Returns all absences.
get.description:
Admin or user planning data permissions are required,
            otherwise only the absences of the current user are returned.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

post.summary: Creates a new absence.
post.description:
User planning data permissions are required if the calling user
            is not the owner of the absence or admin.
            The startOn and endOn get rounded to 00:00:00, 12:00:00, or 23:59:59 in UTC.
            These values can be used to set a half-day (pre or post mid-day) absence, or absences that start or end at mid-day.
            The end date needs to be the same or after the start date.

<Info title="Subscription Level">This endpoint requires the Standard plan or higher.</Info>

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The absence to create.

delete.summary: Deletes the absence with the specified id.
delete.description:
User planning data permissions are required if the calling user
            is not the owner of the absence or admin.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: absenceId
parameters.description: The id of the absence to delete.

get.summary: Returns the absence with the specified id.
get.description:
User planning data permissions are required if the calling user
            is not the owner of the absence or admin.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: absenceId
parameters.description: The id of the absence to get.

put.summary: Updates the absence with the specified id.
put.description:
User planning data permissions are required if the calling user
            is not the owner of the absence or admin.
            The startOn and endOn get rounded to 00:00:00, 12:00:00, or 23:59:59 in UTC.
            These values can be used to set a half-day (pre or post mid-day) absence, or absences that start or end at mid-day.
            The end date needs to be the same or after the start date.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: absenceId
parameters.description: The id of the absence to update.

requestBody.description: The model with the updated values.

put.summary: Updates the account with the specified id.
put.description:
Updates the account with the specified id.
Does not update the external account of the user.
Use the 'accounts/connectToSocialAccount' or 'accounts/disconnectToSocialAccount' endpoints instead.
If the email of the account is changed, the email will not be changed immediately but a verification email will be sent to the new email address.
The email will only be changed after the user has verified the new email address.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model to update the account.

For the operation 'delete-all-without-timeentries' project-master-data write permissions are required on all projects of the company. The user must be an admin or have company-master-data:write permissions.

            Returns 207 MultiStatus if at least one tag could not be removed, including the reasons.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

get.summary: Returns all documents.
get.description:
To retrieve a document, the user has to at least have 'read' permissions for the document.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: includeTrashedDocuments
parameters.description: Whether to also include trashed documents.

post.summary: Creates a new document.
post.description: <Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

post.summary: Restores the document with the specified id from the trash.
post.description: Please note that, after a successful response, this method will trigger a number of events that will eventually update/recreate the document and the related entities such as document versions or its content. Required Permissions: The user has at least `manage` permissions for this document.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The id of the document to restore.

parameters.name: alsoRestoreChildren
parameters.description: Whether all children of this document should be restored.

delete.summary: Deletes a document with the specified id, moving it to the trash section.
delete.description: The document itself is deleted synchronously, while its children and related entities are deleted asynchronously in the background if is true. If is false, the children's parent references are updated to point to the deleted document's parent. Required Permissions: The user has at least `manage` permissions for this document.

parameters.name: alsoDeleteChildren
parameters.description: Whether all children of this document should be deleted.

get.summary: Returns the document with the specified id.
get.description: Required Permissions: The user has at least `read` permissions for this document.

put.summary: Updates the document with the specified id.
put.description: Required Permissions: The user has at least `manage` permissions for this document.

requestBody.description: The document to update.

get.description: Returns all comments of the document with the specified id. The user needs read permissions on the document.

post.description:
Creates a new comment on the document with the specified id.
            The user needs read permissions on the document to create a comment.
            A user can only create a comment for him/herself, except for admins and api users.

delete.description:
Deletes the comment with the specified id on the document with the specified id.
            The delete includes the reactions of the comment.
            If there are any replies to the comment, they will be deleted as well.

get.summary: Returns the comment with the specified id of the document with the specified id.
get.description: Returns the comment with the specified id of the document with the specified id.

Updates the comment with the specified id on the document with the specified id.
            InReplyToCommentId is not allowed to be changed.

requestBody.description: The model used to update the comment with the specified id.

post.summary: Updates the reactions of the comment with the specified id on the document with the specified id.
post.description: Updates the reactions of the comment with the specified id on the document with the specified id.

requestBody.description: The model used to update the reactions of the comment with the specified id.

post.summary: Sets the resolved status of a comment.
post.description:
Sets the resolved status of a comment. Users need write permissions on the document to resolve/unresolve comments.
            Currently, the IsResolved property is only available for document comments.

requestBody.description: The model containing the resolved status.

get.summary: Returns the content of the current version of the document with the specified id.
get.description: Required Permissions: The user has at least `read` permissions for this document.

parameters.name: streamAsFile
parameters.description:
Whether the document's content should be streamed as a file.
            By default, the document's content is returned in a model containing a property 'Content' holding the content as a string.

put.summary: Updates the content of the document with the specified id.
put.description: Required Permissions: The user has at least `manage` permissions for this document.

post.summary: Adds a list of document contributors to a document with the specified id.
post.description: Recalculation of permissions for related entities considering the new document contributors will be done in the background asynchronously. Required Permissions: The user has at least `manage` permissions for this document.Adding document contributors will affect their access to the document. Specifically the access of a particular user.

requestBody.description: The contributors.

delete.summary: Deletes the document contributor with the specified id.
delete.description: Deletes the specific document contributor from a document. This operation cannot be performed on inherited document contributors, only explicit ones. There will be recalculation of permissions for related entities considering the deleted document contributor. Required Permissions: The user has at least `manage` permissions for this document.Deleting a document contributor will affect their access to the document. Specifically the access of a particular user.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The document to remove the contributor from, specified by its identifier.

parameters.description: The document contributor to remove, specified by its identifier.

get.summary: Returns the content of the file with the specified id.
get.description:
Returns the content of the latest file version.
If the file is an image and the width and height are set,
the image will resized before it is returned.
The get the content it is necessary to have the 'read' permissions on the
entity the file is related to.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.description: Whether to enlarge the image if the width/height are bigger than the original image.

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: If inline is true, content-disposition header is inline, else it is attachment.

get.summary: Returns the content of the file with the specified id as pdf.
get.description:
Returns the content of the latest file version as pdf.
All kinds of MS Office document types are supported.
To get the content you must have the 'read' permissions on the
entity the file is related to.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: If inline is true, content-disposition header is inline, else it is attachment.

post.summary: Invites a user to the workspace.
post.description:
Invites the user with the email address to the workspace with the specified id.
Sends an invitation email to the user with a link to accept the invitation.
For automated invitation flows, sending the email can be skipped by setting the
'skipSendingEmail' flag to 'true'.
Additionally, the invitation code, which is valid for 24 hours,
is returned so that the caller can accept the invitation right away.

requestBody.description: The model to invite a user to the workspace.

post.summary: Accepts the invitation with the invitation code.

requestBody.description: The invitation code received when creating the invitation.

This includes documents where the user has been explicitly granted permissions,
            is part of a team with read permissions, or is part of the workspace with read permissions.
            Excludes documents where the user already has permissions from the space they're in,
            the project they're in, or when they're the user's own private documents.

get.description:

            Time entries which are started in the future are ignored.
            If a time entry does not have a start time, 12.00 am is automatically assumed as the start time
            for comparison with other time entries from the same day.

get.summary: Returns all activities of the project with the specified id.
get.description:
The activities contain information about the type of the activity, which property was changed and by whom.
This contains changes to first-level properties of the project, like name, description, status, etc., as well as several related entities, such as tags, assignments, etc.
This does not include activities of sub-entities, like tasks of a project or comments on a task.

post.summary: Adds a project member to the project with the specified id.
post.description: Adds a project member to the project with the specified id. The new project member can also be set as a responsible project member, but only if no other member of this project is responsible. It is necessary that the project role is available in this project, otherwise the member cannot be added. A project role is available when they are connected to the specified project type of the project. A user can only be added to the project once. Required Permissions: The user has to be the creator of the project or needs `manage` permissions of the feature `project-master-data`.

post.summary: Endpoint to create a new retainer for a project.

As soon as a retainer is created for a project, the project will be marked as a retainer project.
            Based on the Start and End dates of the retainer, the retainer budgets will be created automatically.
            Retainers cannot overlap. There can only be one active retainer per project at a time (no end date and/or including the current date).
            
            The user needs to have the ProjectMasterData write permission for the project to access this endpoint.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

get.summary: Performs a full-text search across workspace entities.
get.description:
This endpoint enables powerful full-text search capabilities across multiple types.
It returns a ranked list of matching entities based on relevance and respects user permissions.

The search functionality includes:
- Cross-entity search across various entity types in the workspace
- Relevance-based scoring and ranking of results
- Respecting user access permissions for all returned results
- Customizable result filtering by entity type and status

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: The term to search for. Max. 50 characters. Required.

parameters.name: searchTypes
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of types to search for, or 'all'. 
Default: all types.

post.summary: Assigns a new user to a tasks by email invitation.
post.description:
For the invitation, the role of the user has to be specified. The user is then invited to the workspace and assigned to the task.
The user will receive an email with the invitation link, as well as a redirect to the task.
The new user will replace any currently existing task assignments.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model to assign the user.

post.summary: Edits multiple tasks using the specified operation.
post.description:
The user is only allowed to edit tasks they have permissions for. The same applies for related entities like time entries.
Returns MultiStatus. Includes the list of successful and failed tasks.
Returns BadRequest if the validation for either operation or form fails.

Supported Operations:
movetoproject: Moves all tasks to a new project.
movetotasklist: Moves all tasks to a new task list inside the same project.
setdates: Sets the due and optionally start date for all tasks.
addtags: Adds a list of tags to all tasks in the list that don't already have the tag.
delete: Deletes all tasks. Optional including time trackings.
changetypeofwork: Changes the type of work for a list of tasks. Optionally also for the related timetrackings.
assignusers: Assigns a list of users to a list of tasks.
unassignusers: Unassigns a list of users from a list of tasks. If the UserIds are not provided, all users are unassigned.
setprio: Sets the prio flag for a list of tasks.
changetaskstatus: Sets the task status for a list of tasks.
plannerbatch: Multiple operations to a single task. Used in the planner.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The name of the operation to execute on the given tasks.

requestBody.description: The form with additional info for the batch operation.

post.summary: Changes the base type for a batch of tasks.
post.description: Changes the base type for a batch of tasks. This operation will remove the task from the lists it is in. If the task is a parent task, all subtasks are changed as well. If the task has task dependencies to tasks not in the given list of task ids, those will be removed as well. If the task baseType is already the correct base type, no changes are made. The status of the task is matched automatically to the first status of the new basetype based on order and type. Required Permissions: The required permissions depend on the base type of the task. If the task is a project task, `write` permissions on the `project-planning-data` feature are required. For a user's private task, no special permissions are required. Returns `204 NoContent` if all tasks have been changed successfully. Returns `207 MultiStatus` if at least one task could not be changed, including the reasons.

requestBody.description: The model to change types.

post.summary: Changes the lists of tasks.
post.description:
Adds tasks to lists, removes them and reorders tasks within lists.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The form to change the lists of tasks.

post.summary: Changes statuses of tasks.
post.description: Changes statuses of several tasks. Required Permissions: The required permissions depend on the base type of the task. If the task is a project task, `write` permissions on the `project-planning-data` feature are required. For a user's private task, no special permissions are required. Returns `204 NoContent` if all tasks have been changed successfully. Returns `207 MultiStatus` if at least one task could not be changed, including the reasons.

requestBody.description: The model to change statuses.

post.summary: Changes the parent task and the order of subtasks.
post.description:
Changes parent task and order of subtasks. If the parent task of a subtask changed, its lists, base type and entity
            will change to match the parent ones.
            It is not possible to change a task to subtask if the task already has subtasks.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model used to change a subtask.

post.summary: Convert subtasks to a parent task.
post.description:
Convert subtasks to a parent task. If list ids are not provided it will keep the same lists as the old parent task,
            placing the task as last item in the lists.
            If multiple list ids are provided per task, the lists will be overwritten with the lists provided. In this case, if an
            order is not provided, it will be put as the last item in the list.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model used to change a subtask.

post.summary: Changes the type of work for a batch of tasks.
post.description: Changes the type of work for a batch of tasks and their related time entries. Required Permissions: The required permissions depend on the base type of the task. If the task is a project task, `write` permissions on the `project-planning-data` feature are required. For a user's private tasks, no special permissions are required.Returns `204 NoContent` if all tasks have been changed successfully. Returns `207 MultiStatus` if at least one task could not be changed, including the reasons.

requestBody.description: The model to change types.

post.summary: Deletes several tasks.
post.description: Deletes the specified tasks. By default, the related time entries of these tasks loose the relation to the deleted tasks. In order to delete the time entires as well, you need to set the 'DeleteTimeTrackings' property to true. Required Permissions: The required permissions depend on the base type of the task. If the task is a project task, `write` permissions on the `project-planning-data` feature are required. For a user's private task, no special permissions are required.Returns `204 NoContent` if all tasks have been deleted successfully. Returns `207 MultiStatus` if at least one task could not be deleted, including the reasons.

requestBody.description: The model to delete tasks.

get.summary: Returns all time entries.
get.description:
Returns all time entries.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to get the time entry.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry (this includes external timetrackings from connected projects).
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary (this does NOT include external timetrackings from connected projects).

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

post.summary: Creates a new time entry.
post.description:
Creates a new time entry.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to create the time entry.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs permissions on:
            'project-planning-data' if it is a project task.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The form to create a time entry.

post.summary: Edits multiple time entries using the specified operation.
post.description:
The user is only allowed to edit time entries they have permissions for.
            Returns MultiStatus. Includes the list of successfully changed, not found, unauthorized, and invalid time entry ids.
            Returns BadRequest if the validation of the form fails, f.e. the new type of work cannot be found.
            
            Supported Operations:
            delete: Deletes all time entries. Only admins can delete already billed time entries.
            setTypeOfWork: Changes the type of work for a list of time entries. TODO: check if only admins should be able to change
            for billed.
            setIsBillable: Changes the billability for a list of time entries. Already billed time entries can only be changed to
            being unbillable by admins. In this case, the IsBilled flag is also set to false.
            setIsBilled: Changes the billing status for a list of time entries. Only admins can change the billing status back to
            unbilled for already billed time entries.
            setProject: Changes the project for a list of time entries. Only admins can change the project for already billed time
            entries. Setting the project unsets the previous project and task.
            setTask: Changes the task for a list of time entries. Only admins can change the task for already billed time entries.
            Setting the task automatically sets the project if that task is a project task.
            setUser: Changes the user for a list of time entries. Only admins can change the user for already billed time entries.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description:
The name of the operation to execute on the given time entries. Valid values are: delete,
setTypeOfWork, setIsBillable, setIsBilled, setProject, setTask, setUser.

requestBody.description: The form with additional info for the batch operation.

post.summary: Deletes the time entry with the specified ids.
post.description:
This endpoint is deprecated, please use the batch endpoint POST /timeentries/batch/delete instead.
            
            Deletes the time entries with the specified ids.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to delete the time entries.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs permissions on:
            'project-planning-data' if it is a project task.
            If the time entry is billed, Admin permissions are required.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model for ids of the time entries.

post.summary: Sets the time entries with the specified ids to billable.
post.description:
Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to edit the time entries.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs 'write'
            permissions on:
            'project-timetracking' if it is a project task.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model for ids of the time entries.

post.summary: Sets the time entries with the specified ids to billed.
post.description:
Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to edit the time entries.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs permissions on:
            'project-planning-data' if it is a project task.
            If the time entry is billed, the permissions can be ignored because there is no change.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

delete.description:
Deletes the time entry with the specified id.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to delete the time entry.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'

put.summary: Updates the time entry with the specified id.
put.description:
Updates the time entry with the specified id.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to update the time entry:
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs permissions on:
            'project-planning-data' if it is a project task.
            The break duration of the time entry is kept the same. The break duration cannot be smaller than the duration of the
            time entry. To remove the breaks, use the endpoint POST /timeentries/{id}/removeBreaks.
            Following combination of times and duration are allowed for already completed time entries:
            - start time (local or utc) and end time (local or utc) (this option always takes precedence)
            - start time (local or utc) and duration
            - end time (local or utc) and duration
            For running time entries, you can only update the start time (local or utc) while the duration stays 0.

<Check title="Required Permissions">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: timeEntryId
parameters.description: The id of the time entry.

get.summary: Returns the users' workloads per day.
get.description:
Returns the users' workloads per day for projects, tasks, task schedules and calendar events
            that have an overlap with the interval specified by intervalStart and intervalEnd.
            Takes into consideration weekly availability, absences, user capacity, planned efforts, as well as project budget.

<Check title="Required Permissions">The user must be an admin or have user-planning-data:read permissions.</Check>

parameters.description: The ids of the users to get the workload for, as a comma-separated list of Guids.

parameters.description: The end of the interval to filter by.

parameters.description: The number of days from today when the rough planning should start.

parameters.name: fetchDetails
parameters.description:
(Optional - default: false) If set to true, the result will contain the hierarchy of elements that are contributing
to the workload (projects, tasks, appointments).
Otherwise it will return only the workload value.
Works only for single day queries.

parameters.description: Whether to ignore calendar events. Can significantly improve performance.

client_secret.description: OAuth 2.0 client secret string. Only provided for confidential clients.

client_secret_expires_at.description: Time at which the client secret will expire (0 if it doesn't expire).

client_id_issued_at.description: Time at which the client identifier was issued as seconds since Unix epoch.

DynamicClientRegistrationResponse.description:
OAuth 2.0 Dynamic Client Registration Response as defined in RFC 7591.
Inherits all request properties and adds response-specific fields.

urlParams.description:
The URL params to add to the link for verification.
Used for user tracking.

provider.description: The name of the external provider.

externalUserId.description: The id of the user for the external account.

email.description: The email address of the accounts that wants to reset the password.

token.description: The token used to log the user in.

firstName.description: The first name of the account.

lastName.description: The last name of the account.

password.description:
The password to set.
If empty, we will generate one and return the password reset code.

language.description: The language of the account, as a Language Culture Name (de-DE).

timezone.description:
The timezone of the account.
The format of the timezone must be in the IANA standard.

externalLoginProvider.description:
The provider of the external login.
Can be 'google'.

externalUserId.description: The id of the user from the external login provider.

invitationFlow.description:
The current invitation flow.
Use 'invite' for an invitation from a system admin,
'new_user_new_workspace' for an invitation when creating a workspace for a new user or
'existing_user_new_workspace' when creating a workspace for an existing user.

accountId.description: The id of the created accounts.

passwordResetCode.description: The password reset code in case the password was not set.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to get a new access token.

userId.description: The id of the user to create the absence for.

startOn.description: The start time of the absence.

endOn.description: The end time of the absence.

description.description: The reason for the absence.
description.example: Workation by the beach

externalProvider.description: The external provider for the absence.

deletedOn.description: The date the absence was deleted.

deletedBy.description: The id of the user that deleted the absence.

isReadOnly.description: If it's true it means that this Absence is read-only and cannot be edited/deleted by the user.

isHalfDayOnStart.description:
If it's true and it's a single day absence means that the absence is for the first half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it started on the second half of the first day of the absence period.

isHalfDayOnEnd.description:
If it's true and it's a single day absence means that the absence is for the second half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it ended on the first half of the last day of the absence period.

userId.description: The id of the user to create the absence for.

startOn.description:
The start time of the absence.
The time of the date will be ignored.

endOn.description:
The end time of the absence.
The time of the date will be ignored.

description.description: The reason for the absence.
description.example: Workation by the beach

isHalfDayOnStart.description:
If it's true and it's a single day absence means that the absence to create is for the first half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it started on the second half of the first day of the absence period.

isHalfDayOnEnd.description:
If it's true and it's a single day absence means that the absence to create is for the second half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it ended on the first half of the last day of the absence period.

name.description: The name of the country, e.g. "Germany".
The name of the absence region. Should be unique.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. (e.g. 'DE' for Germany)

locationCode.description:
The (optional) location code of the absence region.
It is in ISO 3166-2 format. (e.g. 'DE-BE' for Berlin, Germany)

isDefault.description:
Indicates whether the absence region is the default absence region.
A default absence region is automatically assigned to new employees.

externalWorkspaceId.description: The workspace id that the project will be shared to.

taskBundleId.description: The id of the task bundle to add to the entity.

referenceDateType.description:
(optional, default = TODAY) Defines the starting date from which the reference date is calculated.
The reference date is the date from which the Start/DueOn date of a task is calculated, based on the ReferenceDateAnchor.

referenceDateAnchor.description: (optional, default = START) Defines what the reference date represents for the schedule (start of first task or end of last task).

customReferenceDate.description: (optional) The custom reference date when ReferenceDateType is set to 'custom'.

daysOffset.description: The number of days (positive or negative) to add/remove to the start/end dates of the project.

adjustTasks.description: If true, adjust the start/end dates of the tasks related to the project.

adjustDatesOfDoneTasks.description: If true and Awork.Core.Service.Feature.Projects.Projects.Models.AdjustProjectDatesForm.AdjustTasks is true, include the done tasks in the adjustment.

adjustBookings.description: If true, adjust the start/end dates of the timebookings related to the project.

adjustMilestones.description: If true, adjust the start/end dates of the milestones related to the project.

AdjustProjectDatesForm.description: Form to specify the options for adjusting the start/end dates of a project and related entities.

daysOffset.description: The number of days (positive or negative) that will be added/subtracted the start/end dates of the time bookings.

taskId.description: The id of the task.

billableDuration.description: The total billable duration of time tracked on the task in seconds.

billedDuration.description: The total billed duration of time tracked on the task in seconds.

date.description:
The date of the aggregated times in UTC.
If the AggregatedBy is monthly, the day is set to 1.

totalDuration.description: Summed duration of all times that day/month.

typeOfWorkId.description: The type of work the times are split by. Only set if SplitProperty is 'typeOfWork'.

isBillable.description: The billability the times are split by. Only set if SplitProperty is 'billability'.

isBilled.description: The billability the times are split by. Only set if SplitProperty is 'billability'.

projectId.description: The project the times are split by. Only set if SplitProperty is 'project'.

userId.description: The user the times are split by. Only set if SplitProperty is 'user'.

companyId.description: The company the times are split by. Only set if SplitProperty is 'company'.

taskOperation.description:
The operation for tasks which are not yet done.
The operation is required if you set a list to archived.
Can be:
task-to-done: Set tasks to 'Done' or the first status of type 'done'.
task-remove: Remove tasks from this task list.
task-move: Move tasks to another list.
task-delete: Deletes the non done tasks.

taskListId.description:
The id of the task list where all non done tasks should moved to.
Only necessary if TaskOperation is set to 'task-move'.

deleteTimeTrackings.description:
Set to true to delete also the related time trackings
of all non done tasks.
Only necessary if TaskOperation is set to 'task-delete'.

taskId.description: The id of the task.

email.description: The email of the new user.

roleId.description: The id of the role to which the new user should be added.

firstName.description: The first name of the user to be invited.

lastName.description: The last name of the user to be invited.

gender.description:
The gender of the user to be invited.
Could be 'male', 'female', 'other'

regionId.description:
The id of the region to assign the users to.
If null, removes the user from any absence region.

userIds.description:
The list of userIds to assign to that region.
Providing an empty list of user ids will remove all users from the absence region.

regionId.description: The id of the region to assign the users to.

operationId.description:
A unique id to track the AI operation, provided by the client.
Will be returned in the websocket events related to this async process.

bookingIds.description: The ids of the bookings to fix.

taskIds.description: The ids of the tasks to fix.
The list of task ids to perform the batch operation on.

newTaskListId.description: The id of the new task list. Needed if operation is 'movetotasklist'. Optional if operation is 'movetoproject'.

removeFromCurrentList.description: Whether to remove the task from all its current task lists. Optional for operation 'movetotasklist'.

newProjectId.description: The id of the new project to move the tasks to. Needed if operation is 'movetoproject'.

newParentTaskId.description: The id of the task that will be the new parent of the selected tasks. Needed if operation is 'moveundertask'.

newTaskStatusId.description: The id of the new task status id to change the tasks to. Needed if operation is 'movetoproject' or 'changetaskstatus'.

newDueDate.description: The new due date for the tasks. Optional for operation 'setdates'. If not set, due and start date will be removed.

newStartDate.description: The new start date for the tasks. Optional for operation 'setdates'. Only gets used when NewDueDate is set.

removeDueDate.description: Whether to remove the due date. Required for operation 'setdates'.

removeStartDate.description: Whether to remove the start date. Required for operation 'setdates'.

tags.description: List of tags to add to the tasks. If task already has tag, tag is skipped.

deleteTimeTrackings.description: Whether to delete the timetrackings of each task when deleting tasks. Optional for operation 'delete'.

newTypeOfWorkId.description: The new type of work id for the tasks. Required if operation is 'changetypeofwork'.

changeTimeEntries.description: Whether to change the type of work of the timeentries for each task aswell. Optional for operation 'changetypeofwork'.

userIds.description: Depending on the batch operation, it can be either the ids of the user to assign ('assignusers', required) or the ids of the user to remove ('unassignusers', optional, if not provided unassigns all users).

removeOldAssignments.description:
Whether to replace or add user assignments to a task that has users already assigned. Optional for operation
'assignusers'.

isPrio.description: Whether to set the tasks to be prio or not. Required for operation 'setprio'.

daysOffset.description:
In case of an adjust date operation, define the number (positive or negative) of days that will be added/subtracted to the task dates.
It can be a decimal number (fraction of day)

adjustSuccessors.description: If set to true, it will adjust the dates of successor tasks as well.

adjustSubtasks.description:
If set to true, it will adjust the dates of subtasks of selected tasks.
If set to false, it will only adjust the dates of the selected tasks.

BillingStatusAvatar.description: Avatar for the billability status of a task.

startDate.description: The start date and time of the break in UTC. Required.

duration.description:
The duration of the break in seconds. Required when the end date is set.
When a time tracking is paused, it has at least one break with a start date and no duration or end date.

endDate.description: The end date and time of the break in UTC. Required when the duration is set and the break is finished.

Break.description: The break model. Shows when a time tracking was paused.

Moves all related objects to this company.
Related projects and tasks (including their time entries) will be connected to this company.
Have to set if 'DeleteOperation' contains 'move'.

deleteOperation.description:
Defines the operation to delete a company.
Possible operations are
'move': Move related objects to another company.
'delete-only-company': Delete only the company. Related objects loose the company information.
'delete-all-without-timeentries': Delete all related objects apart from time entries.
'delete-all': Delete all.

importMilestones.description:
Imports the project milestones.

importTaskAndLists.description: Imports the project tasks, task lists and task dependencies.

referenceDate.description:
If provided, it will set the start/end dates of the project and tasks to be relative to this date.
If start or end dates of project/tasks are not available then no relative dates will be set.

userId.description: The id of the user that will have the day off.

startOn.description: The start time of the day off.

endOn.description: The end time of the day off.

description.description:
The description of the day off.
In case of public holidays, it will contain the name of the holiday in the local language.
description.example: Neujahr

englishDescription.description:
In case of public holidays, it will contain the name of the holiday in English.
Null if the day off is an absence.

externalProvider.description: The external provider for the absence, if available.

type.description:
The type of the day off.
Possible values are: absence, holiday, workspaceAbsence.

isReadOnly.description: True means that this day off is read-only and cannot be edited/deleted by the user.

isHalfDayOnStart.description:
A user can be off for a full day or half day (morning or afternoon).
For a single day off, a true value means the user is off in the morning.
For multiple days off, a true value means the absence period starts in the afternoon of the first day.

isHalfDayOnEnd.description:
A user can be off for a full day or half day (morning or afternoon).
For a single day off, a true value means the user is off in the afternoon.
For multiple days off, a true value means the absence period ends on the morning of the last day.

EntityTimeTrackingStats.description:
Model to capture the time tracking statistics for an entity.
Includes the total tracked duration, total billable duration and total billed duration.
The total non-billable duration can be calculated by subtracting the total billable duration from the total tracked duration.
The total non-billed duration can be calculated by subtracting the total billed duration from the total billable duration.

name.description: The name of the Project. Max allowed length: 1000 characters.

isPrivate.description:
Whether this is a private project only visible to members and the creator.
Defaults to false.
Can only be changed from public to private if no times have been tracked on this project.
Can always be made public.

description.example: Sitemap, design, assets and implementation of the new online presence.

Can be null when no color assigned.

referenceDateType.description:
(optional, default = TODAY) Defines the starting date from which the reference date is calculated.
The reference date is the date from which the Start/DueOn date of a task is calculated, based on the ReferenceDateAnchor.

referenceDateAnchor.description: (optional, default = START) Defines what the reference date represents for the schedule (start of first task or end of last task).

customReferenceDate.description: (optional) The custom reference date when ReferenceDateType is set to 'custom'.

If not provided, defaults to the first status of type 'todo'.

subtaskOrder.description: The order of the subtask relative to its parent task.

entityId.description:
The id of the entity the task is related to.
For private tasks, this is optional and will default to the current user's ID if not provided.
For project tasks, this is required and must be the project ID.

baseType.description: The base type of the task. Can be 'private' for a private task or 'projecttask' for a project task.

parentId.description: The id of the parent task. Setting this value means this is a subtask.

lists.description: The list(s) the new task should be added to.

recurrencyRule.description:
The recurrence rule as cron expression. We support all expressions which cronos supports
(https://github.com/HangfireIO/Cronos).
The number of occurrences is limited to 24 a day.

recurrencyInterval.description:
The interval of the executed expression. If the value is 3, only the third time of the expression the recurrence is
actually executed.

relativeDueOn.description:
The relative due date and time of the task created from this recurrence rule, in seconds,
from the moment of creating the task by a recurrence rule.

recurrencyStartOn.description: DateTime when recurring task creation will start, considering the set Recurrency Rule and Recurrency Interval.

recurrencyTimezone.description: The timezone of the Recurrency Rule. If not set, will use the requesting user's timezone.

NestedUserTeamModel.description:
This repeated model (copy of NestedTeamModel) is required to avoid a bug
of the Automapper.Extensions.EspressionMapping library that throws an error if in the same expression
we apply a filter to 2 different models containing the same submodel (e.g: Teams contained in both Project, User and
Tasks))
Please do not remove it.

updated.description: The list of updated items. This includes newly created or modified entities since the last sync.

deleted.description: The list of deleted entity Ids. These are the entities that have been removed since the last sync.

unfilteredUpdated.description:
The list of entity Ids that were updated since the last sync but do NOT match the current filter criteria.
These are entities that are not included in Updated or Deleted lists but may need to be removed from the frontend's filtered store.
The frontend should check if any of these exist in its local filtered store and remove them if present.

inaccessible.description:
The list of entity Ids that changed since the last sync but the user no longer has access to.
These are entities that the user previously had access to (and may exist in the frontend store from previous syncs)
but can no longer access due to permission changes (e.g., removed as project member, role downgraded).
The frontend should remove these entities from the store.

lastSync.description: The timestamp of the last sync operation. This indicates the point in time when the data was last synchronized.

True if the task in this list will be not visible for external workspace users.

trackedDuration.description:
The total duration of time trackings for tasks in this task list, in seconds.
Includes both billable and non-billable time trackings.
Backend-calculated property.
When hierarchy feature flag is enabled: only tasks with PrimaryTaskListId == this list.
When hierarchy feature flag is disabled: all tasks associated with this list.

TaskList.description:
Represents a full task list with calculated duration properties.
Extends TaskList with additional computed fields.

name.description: The name of the list.

isHiddenForConnectUsers.description:
True if the task in this list will be not visible for external workspace users. 
False otherwise.
If null, no change will be made.

order.description: The order of the list.

deleteTasks.description:
Whether all tasks in this list should be deleted.
If false or not set, the tasks will just be removed from the list.

deleteTimes.description:
Whether all times related to tasks in this list should be deleted.
False by default.

id.description: The id of the task list.

order.description:
The order of the task in the list.
If null, the task is moved to the end of the list.

isPrimary.description:
Whether the TaskList should be the primary list for the task.
If not specified for any list of the task, the first list by order will be the primary list.

name.description: The name of the task. Max allowed length: 1000 characters.

description.description: The description of the task. Max allowed length: 25000 characters.
description.example: We need to create a new impactful concept for the customer logo

isPrio.description: Whether this task is marked as priority.

startOn.description: The expected start date and time of the task.

dueOn.description: The expected due date and time of the task.

laneOrder.description: The lane order defines the vertical position in the task board.

plannedDuration.description: The expected planned workload of the task, in seconds.

id.description: The Id of the task.

isExternal.description:
True if the model is coming from an external workspace (awork Connect).
False otherwise.

createdVia.description:
The origin of the task. From which 'flow' the task was created.
Automatically set by the backend.

isHiddenForConnectUsers.description:
True if the task is hidden for external workspace users. 
False otherwise.

baseType.description:
The base type of the task.
Can be 'private' for a private task or
'projecttask' for a project task.

taskStatusId.description: The id of the status for this task.

typeOfWorkId.description: The id of the type of work of this task.

assignees.description: The list assigned users of this task, or empty if not user was assigned.

projectId.description:
The id of the project this task is assigned to.
Only set if this is a project task.
In this case, it is equal to the EntityId.

correlationId.description: The correlation id between parent and subtasks, meaning it's either the ParentId or its own Id.

parentId.description:
The id of the parent task this of this subtask.
Only set if this is a subtask.

isSubtask.description: True if the task is a subtask.

numberOfSubtasks.description:
The number of subtasks of this task.
Null if it's not a parent task.

hasAttachment.description: Whether this task has an attachment.

lists.description: The lists to which the task is assigned to.

entityId.description:
The id of the entity this task is assigned to.
This is the id of the project if this is a project task,
or the id of a user if this is a private task.
See 'BaseType' for supported types.

userId.description: The id of the user of the private task.

tags.description: The list of tags.

createdOn.description: The date this task was created.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created this task.

updatedOn.description: The date this task was last modified.

updatedBy.description: The id of the user who last modified this task.

closedOn.description: The date the task was set to closed.

closedBy.description: The user who closed the task.

order.description: The order of the task in a task status column.

subtaskOrder.description: The order of the subtask relative to its parent task.

createdFromTaskId.description: When the task was created by a recurrency rule, the id is the link to the template of which the task was created.

isRecurring.description: If the task is a recurrency template (used to create new tasks by a recurrency rule), the flag is true.

trackedDuration.description: The summed up duration of all time trackings for this task.

totalTrackedDuration.description: The summed up duration of all time trackings for this task, including subtasks.

totalPlannedDuration.description: The total planned workload of the task, in seconds, including subtasks.

remainingDuration.description:
The expected remaining duration from the original planned effort of the task, in seconds.
Null if the user has no permissions to see time tracking information.

totalRemainingDuration.description: The total remaining duration from the original planned effort of the task, in seconds, including subtasks.

resourceVersion.description:
The version of the entity, updated on every modification, to the ticks in UTC.

recurrencyRule.description:
The recurrence rule as cron expression. We support all expressions which cronos supports
(https://github.com/HangfireIO/Cronos).
The number of occurrences is limited to 24 a day.

recurrencyInterval.description:
The interval of the executed expression. If the value is 3, only the third time of the expression the recurrence is
actually executed.

relativeDueOn.description:
The relative due date and time of the task created from this recurrence rule, in seconds,
from the moment of creating the task by a recurrence rule.

recurrencyStartOn.description: DateTime when recurring task creation will start, considering the set Recurrency Rule and Recurrency Interval.

recurrencyTimezone.description: The timezone of the Recurrency Rule. If not set, will use the requesting user's timezone.

startDateUtc.description: The date (in UTC) when the time tracking was started.

startTimeUtc.description: The time (in UTC) when the time tracking was started.

endDateUtc.description: The date (in UTC) when the time tracking was stopped.

endTimeUtc.description:
The time (in UTC) when the time tracking was stopped.
Required when the time tracking has already been completed and Duration has not been set.

startDateLocal.description: The date (in Local) when the time tracking was started.

startTimeLocal.description: The time (in Local) when the time tracking was started.

endDateLocal.description: The date (in Local) when the time tracking was stopped.

The time (in Local) when the time tracking was stopped.
Required when the time tracking has already been completed and Duration has not been set.

The original timezone of the time tracking.

The duration of the time tracking in seconds.

startOn.description: The start time of the workspace absence.

endOn.description: The end time of the workspace absence.

description.description: The description of the workspace absence.
description.example: Company offsite

regionId.description:
(optional) The id of the absence region to limit the workspace absence to.
If not set, the workspace absence will apply to all users in the workspace.
Otherwise, it will only apply to users in the specified absence region.

isHalfDayOnStart.description:
If it's true, and it's a single day absence means that the absence is for the first half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence, it will start on the second half of the first day of the absence period.

isHalfDayOnEnd.description:
If it's true, and it's a single day absence means that the absence is for the second half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it will end on the first half of the last day of the absence period.

startOn.description: The start time of the workspace absence.

endOn.description: The end time of the workspace absence.

description.description: The description of the absence.
description.example: Company offsite

regionId.description:
The (optional) regionId of the workspace absence.
If null, the absence is global for the entire workspace.
Otherwise, it will be applied only to the users of the region.

region.description:
The name of the region of the workspace absence.
Null if the absence is global for the entire workspace.

isReadOnly.description: If it's true it means that this Absence is read-only and cannot be edited/deleted by the user.

isHalfDayOnStart.description:
If it's true and it's a single day absence means that the absence is for the first half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it started on the second half of the first day of the absence period.

isHalfDayOnEnd.description:
If it's true and it's a single day absence means that the absence is for the second half of the workday.
If it's a multi day absence it ended on the first half of the last day of the absence period.

The mode how the time report should export.
Can be:
"raw": Generates an excel file with all time entries including all fields
"original": Generates an excel file with the options of the report,
for example same grouping, rounding, etc.

Can be: "selectWeek", "currentWeek", "lastWeek",

"selectYear", "currentYear", "lastYear",
"customRange"

A comma-separated list of events that trigger the webhook.
The allowed events depend on the webhook type.
For type 'custom': retrieve the list of allowed events from '/webhooks/eventTypes'
For type 'slack': retrieve the list of allowed events from '/webhooks/eventTypes/slack'

Can be 'none', 'header'.

authentication.description:
The authentication value to use when calling the URI.
Should be 'key=value'.
In case of header authentication, this should be 'headername=headervalue'.
Only required when the AuthenticationType is anything other than 'none'.

The id of the user who last updated this workspace.
Only set after the first invitation succeeded.

isTestWorkspace.description: Indicates if the workspace is a test workspace.

filterby.name: filterby
filterby.description: The filter expression to filter by

scopes.offline_access: Grants continued access with a refresh token

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: The accounts endpoints allow you to manage the basic account details of a user.

tags.name: ClientApplications
tags.description: Client applications are important for the external login flow used by your applications. These endpoints allow you to manage the client applications registered by your workspace.

tags.name: AbsenceRegions
tags.description:
An absence region can be used to define the country/region where the employee is working and as such is subject to the labor laws of that country/region.
                    This will define the public holidays entitlements for employees. Can be used to define regional workspace absences as well.

tags.name: Absences
tags.description: The absence endpoints allow you to manage absences for users.

tags.name: ApiUsers
tags.description: API users are required to create API keys. Changes made by an API client are shown in the UI as the respective API user.

tags.name: AssignedTasks
tags.description:
The assigned tasks endpoints allow you to get all assigned tasks of a user.
                    Project tasks are only visible if the related project is in progress.

tags.name: ChecklistItems
tags.description: The checklist items endpoints can be used for managing the checklist items of a task.

tags.name: Companies
tags.description: The company endpoints allow you to add and manage companies and their details.

tags.name: CompanyTags
tags.description: The company tags endpoints allow you to manage tags on companies.

tags.name: CustomFields
tags.description:
Custom fields are used to extend tasks and projects with additional information.
        They can be used to store additional information. Those are the shared endpoints to work with custom field definitions.

tags.name: Dashboards
tags.description: The dashboards endpoints allow you to work with user's dashboards.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description: The documents endpoints allow you to create and manage documents, their versions and related entities such as contributors or connected teams.

tags.name: DocumentSpaces
tags.description: The document spaces endpoints allow you to create and manage document spaces and related entities such as contributors or connected teams.

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description:
The permissions endpoints provide the permission information of the workspace.
                            That includes the complete permission set of the currently logged-in user as well as all available features.

tags.name: PrivateTasks
tags.description:
Private tasks belong to a single user.
                     Only the users themselves have access to their tasks and they can only be assigned to them.
                     It is possible to create and assign private tasks to another user in which case both users have access to the task.

tags.name: ProjectCustomFields
tags.description:
Custom fields are used to extend projects with additional information.
        They can be used to store additional information. Project Custom fields are global for the whole workspace (no linking needed).

tags.name: ProjectMembers
tags.description: Project Members feature allows you to manage the members of a project, including adding users, assigning roles, and setting responsible members. Only users with the appropriate permissions can add or modify project members. Roles and responsibilities are enforced according to project type and permissions.

tags.name: ProjectMilestones
tags.description: The project milestone endpoints allow you to work with the basic project milestone data.

tags.name: ProjectMilestoneTemplates
tags.description: The project milestone template endpoints allow you to work with milestone templates for project templates.

tags.name: ProjectRoles
tags.description:
The project roles endpoints allow you to define roles for your project members.
                                   You can assign members to these roles on each project.
                                   If the roles are linked to the project types then the roles are available in every project using this type.
                                   When you want to delete a project role which is still in use, you are required to specify which role the currently assigned members should be assigned to instead.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description:
The projects endpoints allow you to work with the basic project data.
                             If you don't assign a customer to the project, the project will be an internal project.
                             In addition to the normal operation you can handle the project members and tags of the projects.
                             When you assign a user to this project as a project member, you need to specify a project role for this project member. The available roles depend on the type of the project.
                             You can also make one member responsible for the project, which means that we will notify this person if anything of interest happens in the project.
                             The tags help you to add additional values to your projects and to find them faster.
                             If you create new tags, they will be available for all other projects, too.

tags.name: ProjectStatuses
tags.description:
The project status endpoints allow you to define statuses for projects.
                             A status defines the current situation of a project.
                             The statuses of a project type have an order which defines the flow the project typically goes through.
                             Statuses can also be unlinked from the typical flow.

tags.name: ProjectTasks
tags.description:
The project tasks are linked to projects.
                            Only members of the project or users with project management 'read' permissions have access to these tasks.

tags.name: ProjectTemplates
tags.description: The project templates endpoints allow you to define different templates for projects.

tags.name: ProjectTypes
tags.description: The project types endpoints allow you to define different types for projects.

tags.name: Retainers
tags.description: Retainers are used for projects with recurring budgets. Currently only hourly based monthly recurring budgets are supported.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description:
The roles endpoints allow you to configure the permissions of users.
            You have the possibility to manage roles and assign users to these roles.

tags.name: TaskBundles
tags.description:
Task bundles are used to manage task templates, task list templates and task dependency templates.
        They can be imported into projects and simplify reoccuring processes.

tags.name: TaskDependencies
tags.description:
The TaskDependencies endpoints allow you to get all task dependencies of a project or a task.
                    A task can have multiple predecessors and multiple successors through separate dependency relationships.

tags.name: TaskDependencyTemplates
tags.description:
This controller is used to manage task dependency templates. A task dependency template belongs to one task bundle
                        and connects two task templates from the same task bundle with each other. When a project gets created from a project template with task dependency templates,
                        these templates get converted to actual task dependencies.

tags.name: TaskLists
tags.description:
Task lists are a way to group tasks into user-defined lists.
                            Task lists are currently available in projects and for users.
                            This way, each project and each user can have a set of ordered task lists.
                            Task lists can be reordered as well as the tasks within the list.
                            Since tasks can be in multiple lists, the order is only applied to one list and does not affect others.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description:
The Tasks endpoints can be used for general task operations and batch operations.
        The batch operations include changing the task status, assigning users and more.

tags.name: TasksBatch
tags.description: Controller that offers batch operations for tasks.

tags.name: TaskStatuses
tags.description: The Task statuses endpoints can be used for general task status operation. Only for internal purposes.

tags.name: TaskTags
tags.description: The Task tags endpoints can be used for managing tags on tasks.

tags.name: TaskTemplates
tags.description: The Task templates endpoints can be used for managing task templates within task bundles.

tags.name: TaskViews
tags.description:
Task views are saved filters on project tasks.
                             They can be stored by users and shared within the workspace. Users can subscribe to shared task views to use them.

tags.name: Teams
tags.description: The teams endpoints are used to manage the details of your team.

tags.name: TimeBookings
tags.description:
The time bookings are used as a simple way to book a user's time for a specific time frame.
It can be related to a project or not.
Those bookings are then used in the workload to calculate the estimated load of a user.

tags.name: TimeEntries
tags.description:
There are some endpoints which have a V2 version. For those the V1 endpoints will be deprecated in the future.
                    Please use the V2 endpoints instead.
                    The endpoints can be used for general operations on existing time entries.
                    A time entry can be linked to a task and / or project, although it can also be created for the user themselves without any entity link.
                    If the time entry is linked to a project it is also indirectly linked to the company of that project.
                    Similarly, the time entry is automatically linked to the project of the the task.

tags.name: TimeReports
tags.description: Endpoints for generating and managing time report KPIs and configurations.

tags.name: TimeTracking
tags.description:
The v1 versions of these endpoints will be deprecated at some point. Please migrate to the V2 versions.
                These endpoints can be used to start, stop, pause or resume a time tracking as well as to get the last time tracking of a user.

tags.name: TypeOfWork
tags.description: The type of work endpoints allow you to manage your types of work. They are helpful to describe the type of a task or a time entry.

tags.name: UserCapacities
tags.description: The user capacity endpoints allow you to define the work capacity of users.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: The users endpoints allow you to manage the users of your workspace as well as their contact details.

tags.name: UserTags
tags.description: The user tags endpoints allow you to manage tags on users.

tags.name: WorkspaceAbsences
tags.description:
Use those endpoints to define workspace wide absences. A WorkspaceAbsence is an absence that is applied to all the users of the workspace. 
                  It is useful for defining company specific events/holidays, for example.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: The file endpoints to get non shared and non temporay files.

tags.name: FileUpload
tags.description: These endpoints can be used to upload files to the workspace.

tags.name: Images
tags.description:
The image endpoints are used to upload and download profile images, for example for users, projects and your workspace.
                             These endpoints also allow you to crop and scale the image to the size you need.

tags.name: SharedFiles
tags.description: These file endpoints are used to get shared files, for example to provide images in emails.

tags.name: TemporaryFiles
tags.description:
The temporary file endpoints allow you to upload and update files 
    that do not have a connection to any entity. The files can be linked to an entity later.
    They dont show up in awork before they are either linked to a file or marked as a global file. 
    Only the user who uploaded the file has access to the temporary file.

tags.name: ProjectActions
tags.description: The actions endpoints allow you to manage the actions for automations in awork.

tags.name: ProjectAutomations
tags.description: The automation endpoints allow you to manage the automations for projects in awork.

tags.name: ProjectTemplateActions
tags.description: The actions endpoints allow you to manage the actions for automations of project templates in awork.

tags.name: ProjectTemplateAutomations
tags.description: The automation endpoints allow you to manage the automations for projects in awork.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks can be used to get notified about events happening.
                                These endpoints allow you to configure webhooks.
                                Read more about webhooks in the developer documentation above.

tags.name: Autopilot
tags.description: These endpoints allow you to manage the awork autopilot for projects.

tags.name: Search
tags.description:
The search controller provides endpoints to do full-text searching in a dedicated search store.
    If search data becomes inconsistent or corrupted the reindex endpoints can be used to rebuild it.

tags.name: Invitations
tags.description: The invitation endpoints are used to invite users to a workspace. You can invite a new user or an existing user to a workspace. The invitation code is used to identify the workspace and the account to which the user should be linked. The invitation code is encrypted and can only be decrypted by the service. The invitation code is valid for 24 hours.

tags.name: Workspaces
tags.description: The workspaces endpoints are used to manage the details of your workspace.
